title: 시제·태·논리 확장 패턴
description: 복합 시제, 조동사, 관계절, 논리 연결의 고급 문법 패턴 습득

randomization_system.description: 각 스테이지마다 고급 문법 패턴을 유지하되 다양한 어휘와 상황으로 15개 문장 생성

phases.title: 시제·태 확장
phases.description: 미래형 심화, 현재완료, 과거완료, 수동태의 체계적 마스터

phases.title: 조동사·조건문
phases.description: 고급 조동사와 조건문, 가정법의 완전 습득

phases.title: 논리 연결·의사표현
phases.description: 의견, 추측, 목적, 양보 등 논리적 사고 표현

phases.title: 회화 기능 심화
phases.description: 조언, 부탁, 동의, 경험 공유의 자연스러운 표현

phases.title: 뉘앙스·강조
phases.description: 강조 구문, 정도 표현, 의견 변경의 세밀한 뉘앙스

stages.title: 미래형 심화 (will vs be going to)

planned_actions.en: I'm going to study abroad next year
We're going to move to Seoul
She's going to change her job
They're going to buy a new car

spontaneous_decisions.en: I will help you with that

predictions.en: The meeting is going to be long
This project is going to succeed
The test is going to be difficult
Traffic is going to be heavy

stages.title: 현재완료 경험·완료 용법
stages.grammar_focus: Have you ever + p.p.? / I have just + p.p.

experience_statements.en: I have traveled to Japan before
We have eaten Korean food before
experience_statements.ko: 우리는 한국 음식을 먹어본 적이 있어

experience_statements.en: He has lived in America before

experience_questions.en: Have you ever been to Europe?
Have you ever seen this movie?
Have you ever met a celebrity?
Have you ever driven a motorcycle?

just_completed.en: I have just finished my homework
She has just arrived at the office
They have just started the meeting

stages.title: 현재완료 결과·계속 + 시간표현
stages.grammar_focus: I have + p.p. + for/since / I have been + ing

duration_for.en: I have worked here for five years
She has lived in Seoul for ten years
We have known each other for a long time
They have been married for twenty years
He has studied English for three years

starting_point_since.en: She has lived in Seoul since childhood
We have known each other since college
starting_point_since.ko: 우리는 대학 때부터 서로를 알고 있어

starting_point_since.en: They have been friends since high school
He has been sick since yesterday

continuous_action.en: I have been working on this project
continuous_action.ko: 나는 이 프로젝트를 계속 하고 있어

continuous_action.en: We have been waiting for you
They have been discussing the plan

stages.title: 과거완료·과거완료진행형
stages.grammar_focus: had + p.p. (과거 이전) / had been + ing (과거까지 계속)
patterns: When I arrived, he had already + [p.p.] (과거 이전 완료)

past_before_past.en: I had finished work before you came
past_before_past.ko: 너가 오기 전에 나는 일을 끝냈었어

past_before_past.en: She had left when I arrived
We had eaten dinner before the movie
They had studied English before moving

already_completed.en: When I called, she had already gone
already_completed.ko: 내가 전화했을 때 그녀는 이미 갔었어

already_completed.en: We had already decided the plan
They had already bought the tickets
He had already finished his homework

continuous_until_past.en: I had been working for 10 hours
She had been studying since morning
We had been waiting for two hours
They had been living there for years
continuous_until_past.ko: 그들은 몇 년 동안 거기 살고 있었어

present_passive.en: This book is written by a famous author
present_passive.ko: 이 책은 유명한 작가에 의해 쓰여졌어

present_passive.en: English is spoken all over the world
The office is cleaned every day
These cars are made in Korea
The meeting is held every Monday

past_passive.en: The movie was directed by Steven
The letter was written last week
The door was opened by someone

future_passive.en: The project will be finished next month
The new building will be opened soon
This problem will be solved tomorrow
The report will be completed by Friday

stages.title: 수동태 심화 (조동사 + 수동태)
stages.grammar_focus: can be + p.p. / should be + p.p. / have been + p.p.

modal_passive.en: This problem can be solved easily
modal_passive.ko: 이 문제는 쉽게 해결될 수 있어

modal_passive.en: The door can be opened with a key
English can be learned by anyone
This work can be finished today
modal_passive.ko: 이 일은 오늘 끝낼 수 있어

should_passive.en: The report should be submitted tomorrow
The decision should be made quickly

stages.title: 조동사 확장 1 (would, could, might)
stages.grammar_focus: 완곡 표현과 가정을 위한 조동사 활용

would_polite.en: I would like to help you
Would you please call me later?
I would prefer coffee to tea
Would you mind opening the window?

could_possibility.en: She could be at home now
could_possibility.ko: 그녀는 지금 집에 있을 수도 있어

could_possibility.en: We could go to the movies
could_possibility.ko: 우리는 영화를 보러 갈 수도 있어

could_possibility.en: They could finish the work today
could_possibility.ko: 그들은 오늘 일을 끝낼 수도 있어

could_possibility.en: He could help us with this
could_possibility.ko: 그는 이것으로 우리를 도울 수도 있어

might_speculation.en: She might be late for the meeting

stages.title: 조동사 확장 2 (should have, could have, might have)
stages.grammar_focus: 과거에 대한 후회, 추측, 가능성 표현

should_have_regret.en: You should have called me earlier
We should have left home sooner
They should have been more careful
She should have told me the truth

could_have_possibility.en: I could have helped you yesterday
She could have won the competition
We could have finished it earlier
could_have_possibility.ko: 우리는 더 일찍 끝낼 수 있었는데

could_have_possibility.en: They could have arrived on time
could_have_possibility.ko: 그들은 시간에 맞춰 도착할 수 있었는데

could_have_possibility.en: He could have passed the exam

might_have_speculation.en: She might have forgotten the meeting
They might have taken a different route
We might have made a mistake
It might have been a wrong decision

real_conditions.en: If it rains, I will stay home
If you study hard, you will pass
If we leave early, we will arrive on time
real_conditions.ko: 일찍 떠나면 시간에 맞춰 도착할 거야

real_conditions.en: If she calls, I will answer
If they come, we will start the meeting

unreal_conditions.en: If I had money, I would travel
If you were here, I would be happy
If we had time, we would help you
If she knew English, she would get the job
unreal_conditions.ko: 영어를 안다면 그 직업을 얻을 텐데

unreal_conditions.en: If they studied harder, they would pass

unless_conditions.en: Unless you hurry, you will be late
Unless it rains, we will go out
Unless she calls, I won't wait
unless_conditions.ko: 그녀가 전화하지 않으면 기다리지 않을 거야

unless_conditions.en: Unless they agree, we can't start
unless_conditions.ko: 그들이 동의하지 않으면 시작할 수 없어

unless_conditions.en: Unless you practice, you won't improve
unless_conditions.ko: 연습하지 않으면 실력이 늘지 않을 거야

stages.title: 가정법 과거 (If I were you)
stages.grammar_focus: 가정법 과거를 통한 조언과 비현실적 상황
patterns: If I were you, I would + [동사원형]

advice_giving.en: If I were you, I would accept the offer
advice_giving.ko: 내가 너라면 그 제안을 받아들일 거야

advice_giving.en: If I were you, I would study abroad
If I were you, I would quit that job
advice_giving.ko: 내가 너라면 그 일을 그만둘 거야

advice_giving.en: If I were you, I would apologize
If I were you, I would save money

hypothetical_situations.en: If I were rich, I would buy a house
If I were younger, I would learn more languages
hypothetical_situations.ko: 내가 더 젊다면 더 많은 언어를 배울 텐데

hypothetical_situations.en: If I were the president, I would change the law
If I were taller, I would play basketball
hypothetical_situations.ko: 내가 더 크다면 농구를 할 텐데

hypothetical_situations.en: If I were free, I would travel the world

wishes.en: I wish I were more confident
I wish I were fluent in English
I wish I were living in Korea
I wish I were better at cooking
I wish I were able to help

stages.title: 가정법 과거완료 (If I had known)
stages.grammar_focus: 과거에 대한 후회와 가정을 나타내는 3형식 조건문
patterns: If I had + [p.p.], I would have + [p.p.]
If I hadn't + [p.p.], I wouldn't have + [p.p.]

past_regrets.en: If I had known, I would have helped
If I had studied harder, I would have passed
If I had left earlier, I wouldn't have been late
past_regrets.ko: 더 일찍 떠났다면 늦지 않았을 텐데

past_regrets.en: If I had saved money, I could have bought it
past_regrets.ko: 돈을 저축했다면 그것을 살 수 있었을 텐데

past_regrets.en: If I had listened to you, I wouldn't have failed
past_regrets.ko: 네 말을 들었다면 실패하지 않았을 텐데

alternative_past.en: If she had come, we would have started
If they had called, we would have waited
If he had asked, I would have said yes
If we had known, we would have prepared
If it hadn't rained, we would have gone

past_wishes.en: I wish I had studied abroad
I wish I had met you earlier
past_wishes.ko: 너를 더 일찍 만났었으면 좋았을 텐데

past_wishes.en: I wish I had learned English sooner
past_wishes.ko: 영어를 더 일찍 배웠었으면 좋았을 텐데

past_wishes.en: I wish I had taken that opportunity
I wish I had been more careful

subject_relative.en: The person who called you is my friend
The book which is on the table is mine
subject_relative.ko: 테이블 위에 있는 책은 내 것이야

subject_relative.en: The student who studies hard will succeed
The car which was parked outside is new
The woman who lives next door is a teacher

object_relative.en: The movie that we watched was amazing
The person whom I met yesterday is famous
The book which I bought is interesting
The food that she cooked was delicious
The place which we visited was beautiful

relative_omitted.en: The movie we watched was amazing
The person I met yesterday is famous
The book I bought is interesting
The food she cooked was delicious
The place we visited was beautiful

time_when.en: I remember the day when we first met
That was the year when I graduated
Do you remember the time when we were kids?
The moment when I saw you was special
That's the season when flowers bloom

place_where.en: This is the place where I grew up
The school where I studied is nearby
I know the restaurant where we can eat
place_where.ko: 우리가 먹을 수 있는 식당을 알아

place_where.en: That's the city where she lives
The park where we played is closed

reason_why.en: That's the reason why I came here
I don't know the reason why she left
Can you explain the reason why you're late?
That's the reason why I study English
The reason why he quit is unclear

statements.en: He said that he was tired
She told me that she would come
They said that they had finished
He told us that he was leaving
She said that she could help

questions.en: He asked if I was ready
She asked whether we could come
questions.ko: 그녀는 우리가 올 수 있는지 물어봤어

questions.en: They asked if it would rain
He asked whether she was home
She asked if we had eaten

wh_questions.en: He asked what I was doing
wh_questions.ko: 그는 내가 뭘 하고 있는지 물어봤어

wh_questions.en: She asked where we were going
They asked when it would start
He asked why she was crying
wh_questions.ko: 그는 그녀가 왜 울고 있는지 물어봤어

stages.title: 간접의문문 (I wonder if...)
stages.grammar_focus: 간접 질문 어순 변화, 정중한 질문
patterns: Could you tell me + [의문사 + 평서문 어순]?

wonder_statements.en: I wonder if he will come
I wonder if she knows the truth
I wonder if we can finish on time

wonder_statements.en: I wonder if they got the message
I wonder if it will be sunny

polite_questions.ko: 역이 어디에 있는지 알려주실 수 있나요?

polite_questions.en: Could you tell me what time it is?
Could you tell me how much it costs?
Could you tell me when the store opens?
polite_questions.ko: 가게가 언제 여는지 알려주실 수 있나요?

polite_questions.en: Could you tell me why he left?
polite_questions.ko: 그가 왜 떠났는지 알려주실 수 있나요?

do_you_know.en: Do you know where she lives?
Do you know what he said?
Do you know when they will arrive?
Do you know how to get there?
Do you know why she was upset?

i_think.en: I think this is a good idea

I think she will agree with us

In my opinion, we should wait
In my opinion, it's too expensive
In my opinion, we need to change our plan

i_believe.en: I believe everyone deserves a chance
i_believe.ko: 모든 사람이 기회를 받을 자격이 있다고 믿어

i_believe.en: I believe hard work pays off
I believe we can solve this problem
i_believe.ko: 우리가 이 문제를 해결할 수 있다고 믿어

i_guess.en: I guess it will rain today

i_guess.ko: 우리 집에 가야 할 것 같아

im_sure.en: I'm sure she will help us
I'm sure everything will be fine

probably.en: It will probably be sunny tomorrow

probably.ko: 우리에게는 아마 더 많은 도움이 필요할 거야

in_order_to.en: I study hard in order to pass the exam

stages.title: 경험 공유 (I've been to, I've never)

ive_been_to.en: I've been to Japan three times
I've been to that restaurant before
I've been to the new shopping mall

ive_never.en: I've never seen such a beautiful sunset
ive_never.ko: 그렇게 아름다운 일몰은 본 적이 없어

ive_never.en: I've never met anyone like you
ive_never.ko: 너 같은 사람을 만난 적이 없어

ive_tried.en: I've tried calling her several times
I've tried to fix it myself

stages.title: 강조 구문 (It is/was that)
stages.grammar_focus: 특정 요소 강조, 문장 구조 변화

it_is_that.en: It was John who called you
It is here that we first met
it_is_that.ko: 우리가 처음 만난 곳이 바로 여기야

it_is_that.en: It was yesterday that I saw him
It is English that I want to learn
It was her idea that saved us

what_i_want.en: What I want is your happiness
What I need is more time
what_i_want.ko: 내가 필요한 것은 더 많은 시간이야

what_i_want.en: What we should do is wait
what_i_want.ko: 우리가 해야 할 일은 기다리는 거야

what_i_want.en: What matters most is your health
What I like about you is your honesty
what_i_want.ko: 내가 너를 좋아하는 이유는 너의 정직함이야

the_thing_that_matters.en: The thing that matters is effort
The thing that counts is friendship
The thing that helps is practice
The thing that works is patience
The thing that lasts is love

exactly.en: This is exactly what we need
This is exactly like my old school
exactly.ko: 이것은 정확히 내 옛날 학교 같아

much_comparative.en: This is much better than before
She's much taller than her sister
Today is much warmer than yesterday
This job is much easier than I thought
He's much more experienced than me

by_far_superlative.en: This is by far the best movie
She's by far the smartest student
This is by far the most difficult task
He's by far the fastest runner
by_far_superlative.ko: 그는 단연코 가장 빠른 달리기 선수야

by_far_superlative.en: This is by far the most expensive

a_lot_comparative.en: This is a lot cheaper than that
She speaks a lot faster than him
This method is a lot more effective
The new version is a lot simpler
Today was a lot busier than usual

stages.title: 수량·정도 표현 심화 (plenty of, a bit)

plenty_of.en: There's plenty of food for everyone
We got plenty of sleep last night

a_bit.en: This is a bit difficult for me
Could you speak a bit slower?
The weather is a bit cold
I'm a bit worried about the test

a_couple_of.en: I need a couple of days to think
Can you wait a couple of minutes?
I bought a couple of books
We met a couple of times
There are a couple of problems

stages.title: 의견 변경·정정 (On second thought, Actually)
stages.grammar_focus: 대화 중 생각 전환, 의견 수정

on_second_thought.en: On second thought, let's stay home
On second thought, that's not a good idea
on_second_thought.ko: 다시 생각해보니 그건 좋은 생각이 아니야

on_second_thought.en: On second thought, I'll take the blue one
On second thought, we should leave early
On second thought, maybe you're right

actually_i_think.en: Actually, I think we should wait
Actually, I think it's too late
Actually, I think we need help

come_to_think_of_it.en: Come to think of it, I've seen him before
come_to_think_of_it.ko: 생각해보니 그를 전에 본 적이 있어

come_to_think_of_it.en: Come to think of it, that makes sense
Come to think of it, we forgot something
Come to think of it, she was right
Come to think of it, I should call them
